Pre-Game Insights: Despite Les Bleus suffering a defeat at home against Italy, the Red Devils secured a perfect score as they prepared for their journey to Lyon.
Deschamps led the French team to triumph in the 2021 Nations League finals, yet they struggled in their recent campaign, finishing third in their group with just five points from six matches.
The Belgians fell short of making it to the last Nations League finals, and surpassing their best finish of fourth overall, achieved in 2021, would indicate they are making progress.
With only the leading duo in Group 2 set to advance to the exciting quarterfinal stage, France finds themselves three points behind their key competitors and must avoid falling further behind.
Domenico Tedesco’s team is preparing to exact revenge on France for the disappointing exit they suffered from Euro 2024 just two months prior.
Miscellaneous Highlights: France took an early lead just 13 seconds into their Nations League match against Italy.
Italy responded with a stunning equaliser, leaving both teams tied at the half.
Belgium secured a 3-1 victory in Hungary, with Kevin De Bruyne scoring two goals.
Belgium’s captain Kevin De Bruyne opted to forgo a hat-trick by declining a penalty.
Lois Openda had the luxury of missing a penalty as Youri Tielemans had already found the net earlier in a lively second half.
Others: The match will take place on Monday, 9th September 2024, at Parc Olympique Lyonnais, in Décines-Charpieu, France.
The win probability for France is 35%, Belgium is 30%, and the draw is 35%.
Broadcasting Rights are granted to Hulu + Live TV package in the United States.
In the United Kingdom and Ireland, the match will be broadcast live on ITV channels and ITVX.
In India, the match will be broadcast live on SonyLIV and JioTV apps and OTT platforms.
